workflow.research_instructions: Parse and validate form fields. Required fields: [hospital_name], [hospital_city], [hospital_state], [due_date]. Optional fields: [patient_city], [patient_state], [patient_zip], [country], [search_radius_miles], [birth_preferences], [partner_name], [support_people], [language], [insurance_current], [insurance_state], [household_income], [family_size], [employer_insurance_available], [preferred_doctor_or_midwife], [preferred_birth_style], [cesarean_history], [twins_or_multiples], [risk_factors], [email], [phone]. Compute: gestational_week, days_to_due_date, trimester, season_at_due_date (by hemisphere). Set defaults: [search_radius_miles]=25 if missing; [country]=USA if missing. Output a clean JSON context block that later steps can consume.
workflow.workflow_description: A personalized 12-page birth plan and hospital bag guide that auto-fills with your hospital’s maps, parking, staff, floor layout, policies, tailored packing lists by season, insurance picks, and curated local crib deals plus Hermes babywear.

steps.step_description: Normalize inputs, compute key dates, and set safe defaults.
steps.instructions: Parse and validate form fields. Required fields: [hospital_name], [hospital_city], [hospital_state], [due_date]. Optional fields: [patient_city], [patient_state], [patient_zip], [country], [search_radius_miles], [birth_preferences], [partner_name], [support_people], [language], [insurance_current], [insurance_state], [household_income], [family_size], [employer_insurance_available], [preferred_doctor_or_midwife], [preferred_birth_style], [cesarean_history], [twins_or_multiples], [risk_factors], [email], [phone]. Compute: gestational_week, days_to_due_date, trimester, season_at_due_date (by hemisphere). Set defaults: [search_radius_miles]=25 if missing; [country]=USA if missing. Output a clean JSON context block that later steps can consume.

steps.step_description: Gather hospital-specific details: address, L&D unit info, parking, floor layout, policies, contacts.
steps.instructions: Using [hospital_name], [hospital_city], [hospital_state], research official and reputable sources. Collect: full address, main phone, L&D triage phone (if public), admissions/check-in process, visitor policy, L&D unit location, NICU availability/level, anesthesia/OR availability, typical postpartum room type, baby-friendly designation status, on-site amenities, breastfeeding/lactation support, and any pre-registration links. Find parking locations with names, addresses, costs, hours, accessible parking and the best entrance for L&D arrivals. If available publicly, capture simplified floor layout for L&D/postpartum (e.g., what floor, nearby elevators, nurse station); do not include non-public or sensitive security details. Provide a Google Maps and OpenStreetMap link for the hospital and parking, plus coordinates. Include staff directory page URLs (public only; no scraping of private contact details). Summarize tips specific to the hospital (e.g., check-in entrance after hours, where wheelchairs are, cafeteria hours). Return a structured JSON with fields: hospital_profile, parking, entrances, wayfinding_notes, policies, amenities, sources (array of {title, url}).

steps.step_description: Identify top insurance options accepted by the selected hospital.
steps.instructions: Using [insurance_state], [household_income], [family_size], [employer_insurance_available], [insurance_current], [due_date], and the hospital acceptance list from the prior step, find 2–4 strong insurance options that are likely the best fit. Prioritize: plans in-network with the hospital and [preferred_doctor_or_midwife], low total cost of care for maternity (premium + out-of-pocket), strong maternity benefits, and newborn coverage. Use authoritative sources: Healthcare.gov or state exchange, insurer sites, and the hospital's accepted plans page. Provide plan name, metal tier, monthly premium estimate for the family size, deductible, out-of-pocket max, network type (HMO/PPO/EPO), in-network confirmation with source link, maternity coverage highlights, and enrollment deadlines. Clarify if COBRA or Medicaid/CHIP may apply. Include a brief non-advisory disclaimer. Return JSON: insurance_recommendations (array), methodology, sources.

steps.step_description: Curate nearby crib listings with image URLs.
steps.instructions: Search for cribs near [patient_city], [patient_state], [patient_zip] within [search_radius_miles] miles. Target public listings first on Facebook Marketplace (only publicly viewable pages), then reputable alternatives (Craigslist, OfferUp, Nextdoor public listings, local baby consignment stores). Extract: title, price, condition, city, approximate distance, primary image_url, listing_url, posted_date (if visible), seller notes (brief), and safety notes (e.g., ensure JPMA certification; avoid drop-side cribs). Provide at least 6 items if available. Do not bypass paywalls or logins. Return JSON: local_crib_listings (array) and sources.

steps.step_description: Select Hermes baby clothing and accessories with images and links.
steps.instructions: Source Hermes baby items (onesies, blankets, hats, booties, bibs) from Hermes.com and authorized retailers. For each, provide: product_name, category, price, currency, product_url, image_url, available_sizes, colorway, and notable materials. Prefer official product imagery. Return JSON: hermes_baby_catalog (array) and sources.

steps.step_description: Tailor hospital bag lists to due date season and local climate.
steps.instructions: Use [patient_city], [patient_state or country], and [due_date]. Research typical weather and temperature ranges for the due month using reputable climate sources (e.g., NOAA, Met.no, Meteoblue, national meteorological office). With code, compute gestational timeline milestones and packing adjustments for seasonality (heat/cold), potential snow/heatwave contingencies, and regional needs. Output granular, deduplicated packing lists: birthing person, partner/support, baby, documents & insurance, comfort, tech & chargers, toiletries, snacks & hydration, postpartum care, lactation, c-section extras (if [cesarean_history]=true or as contingency), NICU go-bag contingency. Note hospital-provided items from prior step to avoid overpacking. Return JSON: packing_lists (object), climate_summary, assumptions, sources.

steps.step_description: Create annotated map(s) for hospital arrival, parking, and L&D location.
steps.instructions: Using coordinates and entrance/parking info from Hospital & Logistics Research, generate at least two images: (1) Campus Arrival Map with pins for Main Entrance, L&D Entrance, Emergency, Parking Garages/Lots (label names), accessible routes; (2) L&D Wayfinding Schematic showing elevators, triage, nurse station, OR, postpartum rooms, NICU (if available), and check-in desk. Include clear labels, high-contrast colors, and print-friendly style. If floor-level details are not publicly available, create a generic but helpful schematic and note that it is approximate. Output image assets with captions and alt text. Return JSON: map_images (array of {title, alt, image_url or data_uri, caption}).

steps.step_description: Compose a concise, hospital-aware birth plan.
steps.instructions: Based on [birth_preferences], [preferred_birth_style], [support_people], and the hospital policies from research, draft a one- to two-page birth plan with sections: Support Team & Communication; Environment & Mobility; Monitoring; Pain Management; Interventions & Consent; Pushing & Positions; Cesarean Preferences; Immediate Newborn Care (delayed cord clamping, skin-to-skin, vitamin K/eye ointment, Hep B, rooming-in); Feeding & Lactation; Cultural/Religious Considerations; Special Notes & Allergies. Flag any hospital policy conflicts neutrally and suggest alternatives. Keep language clear, respectful, and concise. Return JSON: birth_plan {sections...}.

steps.step_description: Assemble the 12-page guide as styled, print-ready HTML.
steps.instructions: Combine outputs from prior steps into a cohesive, 12-page-equivalent HTML document with inline CSS optimized for print (Letter/A4). Structure: 1) Cover (title, names, hospital, due date); 2) Table of Contents; 3) Hospital Quick Facts; 4) Parking & Arrivals; 5) Floor Layout & Wayfinding (with images from map_images); 6) Check-in & Policies; 7) Personalized Packing Lists; 8) Birth Plan; 9) Insurance Recommendations; 10) Local Crib Deals (with images/links); 11) Hermes Babywear Picks (with images/links); 12) Emergency & Resources (L&D, NICU, lactation contacts). Include accessible markup (headings, alt text), page-break CSS between major sections, and clickable links. Cite sources in a References section at the end with titles and URLs. Ensure valid, complete HTML.

steps.step_description: Validate HTML, fix accessibility issues, and summarize fixes.
steps.instructions: Programmatically validate the generated HTML: check for missing alt text, color contrast, heading hierarchy, link text clarity, and print pagination consistency. Apply non-destructive fixes and output a brief QA report summarizing issues found and resolved. Return the corrected final HTML.

steps.step_description: Convert final HTML into a paginated PDF with headers/footers.
steps.instructions: Render the final HTML to a multi-page PDF suitable for printing. Add header/footer: left=Baby-Day Blueprint, center=[hospital_name], right=Page X of Y. Preserve images at print-friendly resolution and ensure page breaks align with sections. Output the PDF as a downloadable file along with the final HTML, returning file names/paths or links as supported.

template.html_content:
Free Download • 12‑Page Birth Plan & Hospital Bag List

Personalized Birth Plan + Hospital Bag Checklist

Built to be customized for your hospital, due date, and preferences. Includes a printable 12‑section birth plan, season‑specific packing guide, hospital maps and parking, team roles, tips, insurance insights, and curated baby shopping links.

Get a Personalized Version
Editable • Print‑ready
Mobile‑friendly
Evidence‑informed

Parent & Pregnancy Details (Sample)

Birthing Parent: Jordan Taylor Partner: Avery Pregnancy: 39 weeks Language: English
Hospital: NYU Langone — Tisch Hospital, New York, NY Due Date: Feb 20, 2026 OB/GYN Clinic: NYU Langone OB Associates Pediatrician: East Side Pediatrics

Note: This sample uses NYU Langone — Tisch Hospital to demonstrate hospital‑specific sections. Replace with your hospital to auto‑adapt parking, season‑aware packing, and policies. Always verify details with your facility.

Get a Personalized Version

Paste your hospital name and due date to auto‑tailor packing items, map, parking, and reminders.

  • Adjusts for season and length of stay
  • Links to official policies and parking
  • Creates a newborn care checklist
Start Personalizing

12‑Section Birth Plan (Sample)

Print‑ready. Share with your care team on arrival. Keep flexible: clinical needs may change.

1) Environment & Communication

  • Quiet room, dim lights, limit nonessential interruptions
  • Introduce all staff on entry; share roles clearly
  • Preferences to be discussed with both parent and partner

2) Mobility & Monitoring

  • Encourage walking and position changes as tolerated
  • Intermittent fetal monitoring if medically appropriate
  • Wireless telemetry preferred if continuous monitoring required

3) Hydration & Nutrition

  • Clear fluids as allowed by hospital policy
  • Ice chips available; IV only if indicated

4) Pain Management

  • Non‑medicated coping first: shower, birthing ball, massage
  • Epidural on request; option to delay until active labor
  • Nitrous oxide if available

5) Induction & Augmentation

  • Discuss Bishop score; prefer membrane sweep before Pitocin if appropriate
  • Interventions explained with benefits/risks/alternatives

6) Second Stage (Pushing)

  • Open‑glottis pushing; positions of comfort
  • Perineal support, warm compresses to reduce tearing
  • Episiotomy only if medically necessary

7) Delivery Preferences

  • Partner to announce sex (if not previously known)
  • Golden hour skin‑to‑skin immediately if baby stable
  • Delayed cord clamping ~60–120 seconds when safe

8) Third Stage (Placenta)

  • Active management if indicated; otherwise physiologic
  • Placenta disposition per hospital policy

9) Newborn Care

  • Vitamin K and erythromycin: yes
  • First bath delayed >12 hours; measurements after bonding if possible
  • Room‑in; partner to accompany baby for procedures

10) Feeding Plan

  • Exclusive breastfeeding if possible; formula only by request or medical need
  • Lactation consult within first 12 hours

11) Visitors & Photos

  • Limit visitors to immediate family day 1
  • No social media posts without parent approval

12) Unplanned Cesarean

  • Clear drape or mirror if feasible; partner present
  • Skin‑to‑skin in OR/PACU when safe; gentle cesarean approach
Signature(s): __________________________ Date: __________

Hospital Bag Checklist (Tailored for Late Winter in NYC)

Due date: Feb 20 ⇒ Cold weather prep, dry air, potentially icy travel. Pack layers and easy‑wash items.

Hospital typically provides pads, mesh underwear, peri bottle, diapers, and wipes—confirm at admission.

NYU Langone — Tisch Hospital Guide (Sample)

Parking & Drop‑off
Use the main hospital entrance for Labor & Delivery drop‑off. Confirm current parking rates and valet availability. Official parking info: nyulangone.org/locations/parking-at-nyu-langone
Arriving in Labor
Call your OB or L&D before arrival if possible. Bring preregistration confirmation to expedite check‑in.
Visitor Policies
Visitor hours and number of support people may change. Verify latest policy on the hospital website before heading in.
This is a non‑official guide prepared for planning purposes. Always follow hospital signage and staff directions; details can change.

L&D Floor Layout (Illustrative)

Diagram is illustrative only. Confirm exact locations on arrival or via the hospital’s wayfinding app.

Check‑In & Triage

Initial assessment, monitoring, admission decisions.

Labor Rooms

Private rooms with monitoring, showers; birthing ball on request.

Operating Rooms

Cesarean and assisted procedures; recovery adjacent.

Newborn Nursery

Optional; room‑in is encouraged when appropriate.

Postpartum Unit

Recovery rooms; lactation support available daily.

Family Lounge

Snacks, seating; visitor limits may apply.

Your Care Team (Typical Roles)

Attending OB/GYN
Leads delivery and surgical care if needed.
Labor & Delivery Nurse
Primary bedside support, monitoring, comfort measures.
Anesthesiologist/CRNA
Epidural/spinal and pain management.
Midwife (if applicable)
Physiologic labor support; collaborates with OB.
Pediatrician/Neonatologist
Newborn exam, resuscitation if needed.
Lactation Consultant (IBCLC)
Feeding support, latch assessment, pumping plan.

Ask your nurse to note names on the whiteboard at shift change. You can request a huddle to review your preferences.

Hospital‑Specific Tips (Sample for NYU Langone — Tisch)

  • Lactation Support
    Ask for lactation within the first morning after birth. Bring your feeding plan; formula is available upon request.
  • Meal Timing
    Cafeteria hours can be limited overnight. Pack shelf‑stable snacks for the partner.
  • Quiet Hours
    Use white noise to buffer night rounding; ask for a “Do Not Disturb” window if baby is sleeping and stable.

Insurance & Billing Insights

“Best” plans vary by state, employer options, and network. For NYC academic centers, families often report smooth maternity experiences with large PPO networks.

Coverage Types
  • PPO: widest hospital choice, higher premiums, lower referral friction
  • HMO/EPO: lower premiums, but stricter networks and referrals
Frequently Compatible in NYC
  • Blue Cross Blue Shield PPO (Empire BCBS)
  • UnitedHealthcare Choice/Choice Plus
  • Aetna PPO/Open Choice
Confirm your specific plan and provider IDs with the hospital’s insurance office for the most accurate, current network status.
Action Steps (Before 28 Weeks)
  • Verify in‑network status for OB, hospital, anesthesiology, neonatology
  • Ask for global maternity billing estimate and newborn coverage start
  • Preauthorize breast pump; confirm lactation visit coverage
Contact hospital financial counseling for up‑to‑date, plan‑specific guidance. Keep screenshots of verification calls.

Local Cribs — Facebook Marketplace (New York, NY)

Tap a search to view current local listings. Images below are representative of typical crib styles; marketplace images and availability change frequently.

Search: Cribs near New York Search: Bassinets
Marketplace Search Link
$100–$350 typical
Click to see current NYC listings
View listings →
Marketplace Search Link
$150–$500 typical
Convertible 3‑in‑1 / 4‑in‑1 styles
View listings →
Marketplace Search Link
$120–$400 typical
Unfinished or non‑toxic finishes preferred
View listings →

Safety check: Verify model, recall status (CPSC), hardware completeness, and mattress fit (<2 fingers gap). Avoid drop‑side cribs.

Hermès Baby Clothes — Online Picks

Explore the official Hermès Baby collection for luxe newborn sets and layette items. Availability and images change—shop the official site for current styles.

Shop Hermès Baby (Official) Clothing & Shoes
Hermès Inspired
Premium Knitwear
Look for cashmere/cotton blend newborn cardigans
See current styles →
Hermès Inspired
Layette Sets
Giftable sets: onesie, hat, booties, bib
Shop layette →
Hermès Inspired
Booties & Accessories
Silk/cotton accessories for newborn photos
Browse accessories →

Sizing tip: For winter due dates, consider 0–3M for longer use. Keep tags until after first try‑on.

Newborn Care Checklist

Weather & Travel Prep (NYC • February)

  • Check live traffic and street parking near discharge time
  • Warm layers and blanket for parent and baby; no bulky coats in car seat
  • Install car seat base before week 36; practice harness fit
  • Plan salted/cleared route and backup ride option
Keep hospital’s L&D number saved. Call if contractions every 5–1–1, fluid leakage, bleeding, or reduced fetal movement.

Contacts & Links (Sample)

Labor & Delivery Unit

NYU Langone — Tisch Hospital
Main switchboard: (212) 263‑7300
Website: nyulangone.org

Insurance & Billing

Financial counseling: see hospital “Billing & Insurance” page
Insurance & Billing

Urgent Concerns

Call your OB practice first when possible
Emergency: Dial 911

How to Use This Lead Magnet

  1. Replace the hospital name and due date at the top to auto‑tailor season and on‑site info.
  2. Review each of the 12 birth plan sections with your provider by 36 weeks.
  3. Print two copies for your hospital bag and share digitally with your support person.
  4. Use the Marketplace searches and Hermès links to source baby items; verify safety and authenticity.
  5. Call your hospital to confirm parking, visitor policy, and lactation consult availability the week before your due date.
Copyright © Your Brand. Educational use only; not medical advice. Verify all hospital details directly with your facility.
template.template_description: Enter a hospital name and due date to generate a 12-page personalized birth plan and hospital bag list with a hospital map, parking and floor layout, staff details, local tips, and insurance recommendations, plus local Facebook Marketplace crib listings and Hermes baby clothes links with images.

form.form_name: Personalized Birth Plan & Hospital Bag Lead Capture

fields.label: Hospital Name & Location
fields.placeholder: e.g., Mercy General Hospital, Sacramento, CA

fields.label: Current Insurance Provider (optional)
fields.placeholder: e.g., Blue Cross PPO, Aetna HMO, NHS, etc.
